basics.name: Hardik Rajpal
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher
basics.summary: I am a complexity scientist who finds joy in studying emergent phenomenon in nature, economy, society and the brain.

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Statistical Physics of Cognition is a project focused on investigationg the role of critical brain dynamics in cognition using experimental, mathematical and computational methods. Key workflows of the project involve,
highlights: Analysis of large-scale neuronal calcium imaging datasets generated from a 2p mesoscope.
Information-theoretic analysis to infer distance to criticality.
Quantifying emergence in oscillatory brain dynamics in neuropixel datasets and mathematical models of spiking networks.

work.name: The Alan Turing Institute
highlights: Analysis of large-scale neuronal calcium imaging datasets generated from a 2p mesoscope.
Information-theoretic analysis to infer distance to criticality.
Quantifying emergence in oscillatory brain dynamics in neuropixel datasets and mathematical models of spiking networks.

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.

projects.name: Miss Direction
projects.description: A mapping engine that misguides you
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript

teaching.name: Complexity and Networks Lab
teaching.entity: Department of Physics, Imperial College London
teaching.summary: Assisted students in hands-on tutorials focused on modelling self-organized criticality, generating scale-free network topology and numerical analysis.

teaching.name: Department of Mathematics, Imperial College London
teaching.summary: Supervised multiple Masters and Undergraduate students, interested in pursuing a dissertation in the field of complexity, networks and neuroscience.
